lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Shade.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Shade.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
If you run into any issues, please open a new issue on the github repository

// Create a scanner to read from standard input.
* A constant string used to visually separate sections of text output.
* The separator is displayed both before and after chatbot messages
* A Scanner object for reading user input.
* A chatbot.TaskList instance, which is used to organize,
* store, and manipulate tasks within the chatbot application.
private final TaskList taskList = new TaskList();
* A map that associates command names with their respective command implementations.
private final Map<String, Command> commands = new HashMap<>();
* Indicates whether the chatbot is currently running.
* Used to manage the state of the chatbot's main operation loop.
* @param name    The name of the chatbot.
* @param scanner The Scanner object used to handle user input.
* Initiates the chatbot's interaction with the user.
this.send("Hi! I'm " + this.name + "\nHow can I help you today?\n(\"help\" to see what I can do)");
String[] parts = input.split(" ", 2); // Split into command and arguments
String command = parts[0]; // First word is the command
String arguments = (parts.length > 1) ? parts[1] : ""; // Arguments string or empty
// Execute command if it exists, or handle unknown command
this.send("Sorry. I don't understand, please try again.");
* Prints a formatted message to the user.
* @param message The message to be printed.
* Reads and returns a line of input from the user.
* @return A string representing the user's input from the console.
* Checked exception for when there is an attempt to
* toggle the state of the task to its current state.
* Creates a chatbot.IllegalTaskStateChangeException with the default message
public IllegalTaskStateChangeException(String task, String prevState, String newState) {
super("Unable to change \"" + task + "\" from \"" + prevState + "\" to \"" + newState + "\"");
* An interface for handling input and output operations.
* Provides methods to send messages and retrieve input.
* @param message The message to be sent.
* Reads and retrieves the user's input.
* @return A string representing the user's input.
* The chatbot.TaskList class encapsulates an arraylist of tasks.
* A list used to store and manage tasks.
* Initializes an empty list to store tasks.
* Adds a task to the task list.
* @param task The task to be added to the list.
* Removes and returns the task at the specified index from the task list.
* @param i The index of the task to be removed.
* @return The task that was removed from the list.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException If the specified index is out of bounds.
public Task removeTask(int i) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException {
* Marks the task at the specified index as completed.
* @param i The index of the task to be marked as completed.
* @throws IllegalTaskStateChangeException If the task has already been marked as completed.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException If the specified index is out of bounds in the task list.
public void completeTask(int i) throws IllegalTaskStateChangeException, IndexOutOfBoundsException {
* Marks the task at the specified index as incomplete.
* @param i The index of the task to be marked as incomplete.
* @throws IllegalTaskStateChangeException If the task is already in the incomplete state.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException If the specified index is out of bounds in the task list.
public void incompleteTask(int i) throws IllegalTaskStateChangeException, IndexOutOfBoundsException {
* Returns the total number of tasks in the task list.
* Returns a concatenated string of task descriptions, where each task is listed with its
* index followed by its string representation. The resulting string separates tasks by
* newlines. If the task list is empty, a default message indicating no tasks is returned.
* @return A string containing the indexed descriptions of all tasks in the list,
* or a message indicating there are no tasks if the list is empty.
* Produces a string representation of the task list. Each task is displayed with its index
* and detailed information. If the task list is empty, a default message is returned indicating
* @return A string representation of all tasks in the list with indices and details.
* Returns a string representation of the task list, where each task is listed with its
* index and description. If no tasks are present, a default message is returned indicating
* @return A string representation of all tasks in the task list.
* Represents an abstract base class for commands that can be executed with provided arguments.
* Subclasses must implement specific command behavior by overriding the execute method.
* Executes the defined logic for the command with the provided arguments.
* The behavior of this method should be implemented by specific command classes.
* @param arguments The arguments passed to the command for execution.
* Represents a command for adding a new deadline task to a TaskList.
* Reference to an IoHandler instance which Handles input and output operations for
* Holds a reference to a TaskList instance, which encapsulates a collection of tasks.
* Constructs a DeadlineCommand with the specified TaskList and IoHandler.
* @param taskList  The TaskList instance containing the collection of tasks to manage.
* @param ioHandler The IoHandler instance used to handle input and output operations.
* Executes the deadline command to create a new deadline task and add it to the associated TaskList.
* @param arguments The description of the task to be added.
ioHandler.send("Uh oh, task should not be empty!");
ioHandler.send("Got it. I've added this task:\n  "
* Represents a command that deletes a task in a TaskList.
* Reference to an IoHandler instance which Handles input and output operations for
* Holds a reference to a TaskList instance, which encapsulates a collection of tasks.
* Constructs a MarkCommand with the specified TaskList and IoHandler.
* @param taskList  The TaskList instance containing the collection of tasks to manage.
* @param ioHandler The IoHandler instance used to handle input and output operations.
* Deletes a task from the task list based on the provided task number.
* @param arguments The task number to be deleted.
ioHandler.send("Invalid task number. Ensure the number is between 1 and " + taskList.getTotalTasks() + ".");
* Represents a command for adding a new event task to a TaskList.
* Reference to an IoHandler instance which Handles input and output operations for
* Holds a reference to a TaskList instance, which encapsulates a collection of tasks.
* Constructs an EventCommand with the specified TaskList and IoHandler.
* @param taskList  The TaskList instance containing the collection of tasks to manage.
* @param ioHandler The IoHandler instance used to handle input and output operations.
* Executes the event command to create a new event task and add it to the associated TaskList.
* @param arguments The description of the task to be added.
ioHandler.send("Uh oh, task should not be empty!");
EventTask newEventTask = new EventTask(parts[0], parts[1], parts[2]);
ioHandler.send("Got it. I've added this task:\n  "
* Represents a command that provides a list of available commands
* and their descriptions to the user.
* Reference to an IoHandler instance which Handles input and output operations for
* Constructs a HelpCommand with the specified IoHandler.
* @param ioHandler The IoHandler instance used to handle input and output operations.
* Executes the help command to display a list of commands available to the user.
* @param arguments This parameter is ignored as the command does not require arguments
Here is what I can do:
`todo <task>` adds a task to the tasklist
`deadline <task> /<by when>` adds a deadline task to the tasklist
`event <task> /<start /<end>` adds an event task to the tasklist
`mark <task number>` marks task number as done
`unmark <task number>` unmarks task number as done
`delete <task number>` deletes task number from the tasklist
* Represents a command for listing tasks in a TaskList.
* This command, when executed, retrieves the descriptions of all tasks
* from the provided TaskList and sends them to the output using an IoHandler.
* Reference to an IoHandler instance which Handles input and output operations for
* Holds a reference to a TaskList instance, which encapsulates a collection of tasks.
* Constructs a ListCommand with the specified TaskList and IoHandler.
* @param taskList  The TaskList instance containing the collection of tasks to list.
* @param ioHandler The IoHandler instance used to handle input and output operations.
* Executes the ListCommand by retrieving and printing a list of task descriptions
* from the associated TaskList. The tasks are sent to the output using the assigned IoHandler.
* @param arguments This parameter is ignored as the command does not require arguments
ioHandler.send(taskList.getTaskDetails()); // Print the task list with details
* Represents a command that marks a task in a TaskList as completed.
* Reference to an IoHandler instance which Handles input and output operations for
* Holds a reference to a TaskList instance, which encapsulates a collection of tasks.
* Constructs a MarkCommand with the specified TaskList and IoHandler.
* @param taskList  The TaskList instance containing the collection of tasks to manage.
* @param ioHandler The IoHandler instance used to handle input and output operations.
* Executes the mark command to mark a task as completed based on the provided task number.
* Sends appropriate confirmation or error messages via the associated IoHandler.
* @param arguments The task number to be marked as completed.
ioHandler.send("Invalid task number. Ensure the number is between 1 and " + taskList.getTotalTasks() + ".");
* Represents a command that terminates the chatbot gracefully.
* A reference to a ChatBot instance
* Constructs a QuitCommand instance that allows the chatbot to terminate gracefully.
* @param bot The ChatBot instance that this command will interact with.
* Executes the QuitCommand to terminate the chatbot gracefully.
* @param arguments This parameter is ignored as the command does not require arguments
bot.send("Bye :) Hope to see you again soon!");
* Represents a command for adding a new todotask to a TaskList.
* Reference to an IoHandler instance which Handles input and output operations for
* Holds a reference to a TaskList instance, which encapsulates a collection of tasks.

* @param arguments The description of the task to be added.
ioHandler.send("Uh oh, task should not be empty!");
ioHandler.send("Got it. I've added this task:\n  "
* Represents a command that marks a task in a TaskList as incomplete.
* Reference to an IoHandler instance which Handles input and output operations for
* Holds a reference to a TaskList instance, which encapsulates a collection of tasks.
* Constructs an UnmarkCommand with the specified TaskList and IoHandler.
* @param taskList  The TaskList instance containing the collection of tasks to manage.
* @param ioHandler The IoHandler instance used to handle input and output operations.
* Executes the unmark command to mark a task as incomplete based on the provided task number.
* Sends appropriate confirmation or error messages via the associated IoHandler.
* @param arguments The task number to be marked as incomplete.
ioHandler.send("Invalid task number. Ensure the number is between 1 and " + taskList.getTotalTasks() + ".");
public EventTask(String task, String startTime, String endTime) {
* The Task class is an abstract class that encapsulates a task. A task encapsulates its
* name and completion state. Tasks can be marked as completed or incomplete.
* Identifier or label of the task.
* Indicates whether the task has been completed.
* If the task is already marked as completed, an IllegalTaskStateChangeException exception is thrown.
* @throws IllegalTaskStateChangeException if the task is already in the completed state.
* Marks the task as incomplete if it is currently in the completed state.
* If the task is already incomplete, an IllegalTaskStateChangeException exception is thrown.
* @throws IllegalTaskStateChangeException if the task is already in the incomplete state.
* Provides a string representation of the task, including its completion status.
* The format includes a marker for completion status ('X' for completed, ' ' for incomplete)
* @return A string representation of the task with its completion status.
* Returns the name of the task as its string representation.
* @return A string representing the name of the task.
